info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 10 at 10:39AM MDT until May 14 at 11:01AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Montana... Little Bighorn River Near Hardin affecting Big Horn County. .A strong storm system will bring heavy rainfall to the area, starting this evening and continuing through Friday night. Rainfall totals of 1.5 to 2 inches are likely through the event. Heavy rain will cause the Little Bighorn River to rise aggressively, with flooding possible. For the Little Bighorn River...including Hardin...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Little Bighorn River near Hardin. * WHEN...From Friday evening to late Sunday morning. The crest will likely be late Friday night into early Saturday Morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 3.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Friday evening, cresting around 8.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Little Bighorn River Hardin 8.0 3.6 Wed 9 am 3.6 6.0 7.9 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning by 1045 AM MDT.
